snippet: Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece is under mounting pressures from many sides, and European leaders hope to help his cash-starved country swiftly meet its financial obligations.
abstract: Top European leaders gather in Berlin to discuss how to handle debt payment Greece must make, even as country needs emergency financing in order to avoid default; Greek Prime Min Alexis Tsipras faces political backlash, even in his own party, over necessity of austerity to receive 7.2 billion euros in aid from International Monetary Fund, European Central Bank and other countries.

byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN, NIKI KITSANTONIS and JACK EWING
byline.contributor: Liz Alderman and Niki Kitsantonis reported from Athens, and Jack Ewing from Frankfurt. Landon Thomas contributed reporting from New York, Alison Smale from Berlin and James Kanter from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece is under mounting pressures from many sides, and European leaders hope to help his cash-starved country swiftly meet its financial obligations.

headline.main: European Leaders Assemble for Urgent Meeting on Greek Crisis
headline.print_headline: Urgently Assembled Meeting for Leaders in Greek Crisis
